title: Smart Strategies to Minimize Your Tax Burden on $70,000 Income
content:
Smart Strategies to Minimize Your Tax Burden on $70,000 Income

Here's a quick way to avoid paying taxes on 47% of your income this year. Let's break it down with a few strategic steps:

  1. Assumed Income: We're starting with an assumption of $70,000 in annual income.
  2. Traditional IRA Contribution: Contribute $7,000 into a traditional IRA. This will reduce our taxable income to $63,000.
  3. 401k Contribution: Next, we contribute another $7,000 into a 401k. This contribution is pre-tax, bringing our taxable income down to $56,000.
  4. Health Savings Account: Additionally, we can put $4,000 into a health savings account, further deducting that contribution and resulting in a taxable income of $52,000.
  5. Standard Deduction: But we’re not done! By taking advantage of the single filer standard deduction of $15,000, we can report our income to the government as $37,000. This strategy allows us to shelter all of our income from the 22% tax bracket, allowing us to pay only 12% on most of it.

If we follow these steps wisely, we could potentially become multi-millionaires in 35 years, without having to worry about healthcare expenses in the future.

If any of this information has been helpful, consider signing up for my free newsletter. Check my bio, where every Sunday morning, I’ll share insights on how to manage your taxes effectively.
subtitle: Discover effective methods to significantly reduce your taxable income and pay less in taxes this year.
